title: (Telstra NBN) Tracert Results - 25ms Ping to 200ms+ Ping throughout ranked.
body:
As title says, getting ping spikes anywhere from +50ms to +200ms while in competitive play.
There's currently no way to tell what's causing it or when it's going to happen so it's either don't play at all, or hold my teammates hostage with my unstable connection.

I don't believe the problem is on my end as League of Legends is the only game that this problem is occurring with.
Posting here in hopes of getting assistance to narrow down whether the problem lies on Riot servers or my internet provider, Telstra.
Have been monitoring network up/down, packets etc in other games like Path of Exile & CS:GO but haven't encountered anything like what I encounter with League.



 1    12 ms     5 ms     1 ms  mygateway.gateway [10.0.0.138]
  2     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  3    65 ms    12 ms    28 ms  144.130.210.209
  4    10 ms    11 ms    11 ms  bundle-ether10.exi-core10.melbourne.telstra.net [203.50.11.109]
  5    23 ms    24 ms    28 ms  bundle-ether12.chw-core10.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.124]
  6    23 ms    25 ms    22 ms  bundle-ether1.chw-edge902.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.101]
  7    78 ms    96 ms    69 ms  bundle-ether2.ken-edge902.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.104]
  8    21 ms    21 ms    21 ms  rio1370642.lnk.telstra.net [165.228.9.78]

The rest of the results were timing out so I decided it was't necessary pasting them.

replies.body: I've been lagging quite a lot throughout late december till now and I never used to lag. I get about 150 - 1000ms
What ISP are you guys with?  Have you checked out your info in lagreport.com?
Yeah the absolute same has been happening to me as well, my usual ping was always around 9ms, now I can barely play the game as it sky rockets to 500ms frequently throughout every match.
Yeah it's the same for me too. I even asked my internet provider about it..

I have been having major issues playing over the last couple of months also - appears to get worse after updates/patches.  I have Telstra ADSL but am moving to NBN (with them) soon.
When I am in games these days my ping reports going to 500ms and I seem to disconnect for a minute or so.
Then I am back in base after either dying or AFK walking back.  Disconnects happen between 3-8 times in a standard game.  If I alt-tab there are no other issues with my connection (e.g. steam, twitch or websites).

Tracing route to 103.240.227.5 over a maximum of 30 hops

....

  7    19 ms    18 ms    18 ms  port-channel5.civ12.canberra.telstra.net [203.50.8.24] 
  8    43 ms    53 ms    52 ms  Bundle-Ethernet6.civ-core2.canberra.telstra.net [203.50.8.34] 
  9    24 ms    26 ms    25 ms  bundle-ether15.chw-core10.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.6.81] 
 10    25 ms    24 ms    25 ms  bundle-ether1.chw-edge902.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.101] 
 11    23 ms    24 ms    23 ms  bundle-ether2.ken-edge902.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.104] 
 12    23 ms    24 ms    23 ms  rio1370642.lnk.telstra.net [165.228.9.78] 
 13  (to 30)    *        *        *     Request timed out.

Running tracert again to test for differing results and we can see that the first tracert has +50ms difference on #3, #8 and a +20ms on 7.

 1    25 ms    17 ms    16 ms  mygateway.gateway [10.0.0.138]
  2     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  3    11 ms    37 ms    72 ms  144.130.210.209
  4    10 ms    10 ms    11 ms  bundle-ether2.win-edge901.melbourne.telstra.net [203.50.11.114]
  5    12 ms    12 ms    11 ms  bundle-ether11.win-core10.melbourne.telstra.net [203.50.11.107]
  6    24 ms    23 ms    24 ms  bundle-ether12.ken-core10.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.122]
  7    94 ms    88 ms    94 ms  bundle-ether1.ken-edge902.sydney.telstra.net [203.50.11.97]
  8    65 ms    30 ms    47 ms  rio1370642.lnk.telstra.net [165.228.9.78]

Hi

Looking at the traces you've posted, it looks like there could be a good first step to take within your home. The first hop (mygateway.gateway) looks like it is varying a bit.   

1 12 ms 5 ms 1 ms mygateway.gateway [10.0.0.138]
--and--
1 25 ms 17 ms 16 ms mygateway.gateway [10.0.0.138]

12ms might not seem like a lot, but in home networking terms I'd consider that quite high.  What is key there is that it varies a lot, which means something isn't playing nice between your PC and your router, or within your router.  You have the most control over the stuff within your home network - if it were me I'd be trying to figure out how to get it right down to be stable at a constant ~1ms, and then move on to other aspects (such as with my ISP) from there.

I'm guessing you're using Wifi?   Does your stability change if you're using an ethernet cable?


Also - We've got a relatively new site up now called [Lag Report,](https://lagreport.oce.leagueoflegends.com/) which might give a bit of insight and help you identify the source of your issues.  I'd recommend you check it out, and also check out some of the things in the "What can I do?" heading.


Cheers
Mindstar
Thanks for the response, I'll have a fiddle with things and see if I can figure out why it's varying.

Where are you running the tracert to?

>Try a tracert to 103.240.227.5, which is in the range for OCE game servers.

>Bear in mind the server itself won't respond to pings, but you will be able to tell from the final hop which should be one of our peers...

>Cheers!
Mindstar

https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/tjYnaU0c-riot-plz-check-your-server?comment=0000

That's as far as my knowledge goes. Support can probs help you more.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Where it's spiking makes me think it's a telstra thing though.
